summary: This document is an email chain from June 13-14, 2019, between Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York discussing a draft indictment against Jeffrey Epstein. The prosecutors debate the charging strategy, the level of detail to include to balance public confidence and victim protection, and preparation for a press conference.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Mentioned as the person who will need material for a press conference to instill public confidence in the case.

events.title: Draft Indictment Review
events.description: A draft indictment against Jeffrey Epstein is circulated among Assistant United States Attorneys for review, with discussions about its content and strategy.

events.title: Discussion on Charging Strategy
events.description: Prosecutors discuss whether a single count can cover all conduct or if each trafficked person must be charged separately, noting potential embarrassment if they 'stumble out of the gate'.

keyFacts: Prosecutors in the SDNY were actively drafting an indictment against Jeffrey Epstein in June 2019.
There was internal debate about keeping the indictment 'sparse' to protect victims and preserve investigative details versus 'bulking up' the facts to instill public confidence.
The email chain reveals concerns about the 'prior history' of the case and the need to demonstrate its 'significance and seriousness'.
A press conference was being planned, with a prosecutor named 'Geoff' needing material to work with for public communication.
The discussion includes a strategic concern about whether to charge a single count covering all conduct or separate counts for each trafficked person.
